hints.label: def-smooth-phase-space-partition-full
hints.title: Smooth Phase-Space Partition
hints.content:
1107: :label: def-smooth-phase-space-partition-full
1108: 
1109: Fix a clustering scale $\varepsilon_c > 0$ and cluster centers $\{(y_m, u_m)\}_{m=1}^M$ in phase space.
1110: 
1111: A **smooth partition of unity** is a collection of functions $\{\psi_m : \mathcal{X} \times \mathbb{R}^d \to [0,1]\}_{m=1}^M$ satisfying:
1112: 
1113: 1. **Partition identity**:
1114: 
1115: $$
1116: \sum_{m=1}^M \psi_m(x, v) = 1 \quad \text{for all } (x, v) \in \mathcal{X} \times \mathbb{R}^d
1117: 
1118: $$
1119: 
1120: 2. **Smoothness**: Each $\psi_m \in C^\infty$ with bounded derivatives:
1121: 
1122: $$
1123: \|\nabla^n \psi_m\|_\infty \leq C_{\psi,n} \cdot \varepsilon_c^{-n} \quad \text{for all } n \geq 0
1124: 
1125: $$
1126: 
1127: 3. **Localization**: Each $\psi_m$ has support concentrated near cluster $m$:
1128: 
1129: $$
1130: \psi_m(x, v) = 0 \quad \text{when } d_{\text{alg}}((x,v), (y_m, u_m)) > 2\varepsilon_c
1131: 
1132: $$
hints.raw_directive:

hints.label: const-mollified-partition-full
hints.title: Mollified Partition via Smooth Cutoffs
hints.content:
1138: :label: const-mollified-partition-full
1139: 
1140: We construct $\psi_m$ using **smooth bump functions**:
1141: 
1142: **Step 1: Smooth cutoff function.**
1143: 
1144: Define $\phi: \mathbb{R}_{\geq 0} \to [0,1]$ by:
1145: 
1146: $$
1147: \phi(r) = \begin{cases}
1148: \exp\left(-\frac{1}{1 - (r/R)^2}\right) & \text{if } r < R \\
1149: 0 & \text{if } r \geq R
1150: \end{cases}
1151: 
1152: $$
1153: 
1154: This is C^∞ with compact support $[0, R]$ and $\phi(r) = 1$ near $r = 0$.
1155: 
1156: **Step 2: Localized bump functions.**
1157: 
1158: For cluster $m$ with center $(y_m, u_m)$, define:
1159: 
1160: $$
1161: \tilde{\psi}_m(x, v) = \phi\left(d_{\text{alg}}((x,v), (y_m, u_m)) / (2\varepsilon_c)\right)
1162: 
1163: $$
1164: 
1165: This satisfies:
1166: - $\tilde{\psi}_m \in C^\infty$ (composition of smooth functions)
1167: - $\text{supp}(\tilde{\psi}_m) \subset B((y_m, u_m), 2\varepsilon_c)$ (compact support)
1168: - $\tilde{\psi}_m \geq \exp(-1)$ on $B((y_m, u_m), \varepsilon_c)$ (positive core)
1169: 
1170: **Step 3: Normalization to partition of unity.**
1171: 
1172: Define:
1173: 
1174: $$
1175: \psi_m(x, v) = \frac{\tilde{\psi}_m(x, v)}{\sum_{m'=1}^M \tilde{\psi}_{m'}(x, v)}
1176: 
1177: $$
1178: 
1179: By construction:
1180: - $\sum_{m=1}^M \psi_m = 1$ (partition identity)

hints.label: proof-lem-partition-derivative-bounds-full
hints.content:
1199: :label: proof-lem-partition-derivative-bounds-full
1200: 
1201: **Step 1: Derivatives of the bump function.**
1202: 
1203: For the smooth cutoff $\phi(r)$, standard calculus gives:
1204: 
1205: $$
1206: |\phi^{(n)}(r)| \leq C_\phi \cdot n! \cdot R^{-n}
1207: 
1208: $$
1209: 
1210: where $C_\phi$ is a universal constant (Gevrey-1 bounds for smooth compactly supported functions).
1211: 
1212: **Step 2: Chain rule for $\tilde{\psi}_m$.**
1213: 
1214: Since $\tilde{\psi}_m(x,v) = \phi(d_{\text{alg}}((x,v), (y_m, u_m)) / (2\varepsilon_c))$, by Faà di Bruno formula:
1215: 
1216: $$
1217: \|\nabla^n \tilde{\psi}_m\|_\infty \leq C'_\phi \cdot n! \cdot (2\varepsilon_c)^{-n}
1218: 
1219: $$
1220: 
1221: (using $\|\nabla^j d_{\text{alg}}\|_\infty = \mathcal{O}(1)$ for $j \geq 1$ - see Lemma {prf:ref}`lem-dalg-derivative-bounds-full`).
1222: 
1223: **Step 3: Quotient rule for $\psi_m$.**
1224: 
1225: The normalized partition function:
1226: 
1227: $$
1228: \psi_m = \frac{\tilde{\psi}_m}{\sum_{m'} \tilde{\psi}_{m'}}
1229: 
1230: $$
1231: 
1232: By quotient rule, with denominator bounded below by $1$ (sum of at least one non-zero $\tilde{\psi}_{m'}$):
1233: 
1234: $$
1235: \|\nabla^n \psi_m\|_\infty \leq C_{\psi,n} \cdot \varepsilon_c^{-n}
1236: 
1237: $$
1238: 
1239: where $C_{\psi,n} = \mathcal{O}(n!)$ absorbs the combinatorial factors from the quotient rule.

hints.label: def-soft-cluster-membership-full
hints.title: Soft Cluster Membership Weights
hints.content:
1247: :label: def-soft-cluster-membership-full
1248: 
1249: For walker $j \in \mathcal{A}$, define its **soft membership** in cluster $m$ as:
1250: 
1251: $$
1252: \alpha_{j,m} = \psi_m(x_j, v_j) \in [0, 1]
1253: 
1254: $$
1255: 
1256: This satisfies:
1257: - $\sum_{m=1}^M \alpha_{j,m} = 1$ (walker belongs to all clusters with fractional weights)

hints.label: lem-effective-cluster-size-bounds-full
hints.title: Bounds on Effective Cluster Size
hints.content:
1280: :label: lem-effective-cluster-size-bounds-full
1281: 
1282: Under {prf:ref}`assump-uniform-density-full`:
1283: 
1284: $$
1285: k_m^{\text{eff}} \leq \rho_{\max} \cdot \text{Vol}(B(y_m, 2\varepsilon_c)) = C_{\text{vol}} \cdot \rho_{\max} \cdot \varepsilon_c^{2d}
1286: 
1287: $$
1288: 
1289: where $C_{\text{vol}}$ is the volume constant for phase-space balls.
1290: 
1291: Moreover, the total effective population sums to $k$:
1292: 
1293: $$
1294: \sum_{m=1}^M k_m^{\text{eff}} = \sum_{m=1}^M \sum_{j \in \mathcal{A}} \psi_m(x_j, v_j) = \sum_{j \in \mathcal{A}} \underbrace{\sum_{m=1}^M \psi_m(x_j, v_j)}_{= 1} = k

hints.label: proof-lem-effective-cluster-size-bounds-full
hints.content:
1300: :label: proof-lem-effective-cluster-size-bounds-full
1301: 
1302: This lemma establishes uniform bounds on the effective cluster size using density bounds and geometric measure theory.
1303: 
1304: **Part 1: Upper bound via density and support**
1305: 
1306: From {prf:ref}`def-effective-cluster-population-full`, $k_m^{\text{eff}} = \sum_{j \in \mathcal{A}} \psi_m(x_j, v_j)$. Since $\psi_m$ has support only within distance $2\varepsilon_c$ of cluster center $(y_m, u_m)$, only walkers in the phase-space ball $B(y_m, 2\varepsilon_c)$ contribute.
1307: 
1308: Under the uniform density bound {prf:ref}`assump-uniform-density-full`, the number of walkers in any ball $B$ satisfies:
1309: 
1310: $$
1311: \#\{j : (x_j, v_j) \in B\} \leq \rho_{\max} \cdot \text{Vol}(B)
1312: 
1313: $$
1314: 
1315: The phase-space has dimension $2d$ (position + velocity), so:
1316: 
1317: $$
1318: \text{Vol}(B(y_m, 2\varepsilon_c)) = \frac{\pi^d}{d!} (2\varepsilon_c)^{2d} = C_{\text{vol}} \cdot \varepsilon_c^{2d}
1319: 
1320: $$
1321: 
1322: where $C_{\text{vol}} = 2^{2d} \pi^d / d!$. Therefore:
1323: 
1324: $$
1325: k_m^{\text{eff}} \leq \rho_{\max} \cdot C_{\text{vol}} \cdot \varepsilon_c^{2d}
1326: 
1327: $$
1328: 
1329: **Part 2: Total population conservation**
1330: 
1331: The partition functions satisfy $\sum_{m=1}^M \psi_m(x, v) = 1$ (partition of unity). Summing over all clusters:
1332: 
1333: $$
1334: \sum_{m=1}^M k_m^{\text{eff}} = \sum_{m=1}^M \sum_{j \in \mathcal{A}} \psi_m(x_j, v_j) = \sum_{j \in \mathcal{A}} \sum_{m=1}^M \psi_m(x_j, v_j) = \sum_{j \in \mathcal{A}} 1 = k
1335: 
1336: $$
